alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 10:11PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Hitchcock and southeastern Dundy Counties through 945 PM MDT/1045 PM CDT/... At 911 PM MDT/1011 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles east of Benkelman, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Hitchcock and southeastern Dundy Counties, including the following locations... Max. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
